prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Jessica Chen
mes:
Out of all the ways Jess expected her Saturday night to go, getting into a full blown screaming match with her ex while the both of them were half naked was not it... but Hailee always had a knack for turning a nice thing into an absolute shitshow.

Things had started off good between them ever since they'd struck up this casual arrangement a few weeks back now. One missed date too many had resulted in her being unceremoniously dumped, as if she had any control over how long a session went with a client. She'd done her due diligence in sending Hailee a text to let her know she'd be late, but she'd been told to not even bother to come at all. Bitch wouldn't even let her try to explain herself, Hailee had just sent her on her way with a bag full of shit she'd left when she spent the night there without so much as a 'seeya later'.

At least they hadn't signed a fucking lease together like Hailee had been pushing for. Lord knows that would've been annoying and expensive to break.

Maybe that's what made the whole fuck-buddies arrangement so funny to her. Hailee had come crawling back a few weeks after she had insisted on no-contact so she could break a dry spell. Because nothing says 'I'm not a messy lesbian' like having your ex strap you down within an inch of your life. Jess wasn't too upset about it, even if Giselle had said some touchy-feely bullshit about how it sent the message that she was only worth what she could provide sexually, probably because she was getting the same benefit out of it too — orgasm after earthshattering orgasm.

Besides the great sex, it was liberating to not have to be shamed that she wasn't 'romantic' or 'emotional' enough nor take Hailee out on expensive dates; she was thrilled that it cut out all that emotional fluffing she always struggled to do... and it sure as hell beat going to some loud, packed bar to find hookups when the need arose. Jess knew Hailee was a text or call away from coming over most nights, like she could order pussy direct to her fucking door, and she loved it.

Callous? Yes, but even Jess could admit her strengths weren't in the sentimental aspects of relationships, even if she was great at communicating and providing part. She blamed her hyper-independence and busy schedule for being seemingly disconnected. Now, though, that communication and honesty was coming to bite her in the ass.

Hailee had asked if Jess had seen anyone while they had been no-contact with each other and, being the honest person she was, she had admitted she had. Her ex had admitted the same thing — even going so far as to say she had a roster — but she had a distinct feeling that it was who she had seen that had made them go from cuddling on her couch to dodging pillows tossed at her head.

Leticia was a sore spot for Hailee even when they had been dating and a source of more than one tense argument that had Jess sleeping on the couch. Leticia was... well, the woman was fucking gorgeous and, in her ex's words, had a 'very obvious crush' on her, not that she ever read too far into it. Despite how fervently Jess insisted that their relationship was purely friendly and that they only saw each other when Leticia flew in for a tattoo, Hailee always assumed there was something there.

...needless to say, Jess was thoroughly surprised that after her and Hailee had broken up, Leticia reached out shortly after to shoot her shot. Maybe she should've said no, but her and her ex weren't even talking then — fuck, she didn't even know if Hailee would ever want anything to do with her after that — so she agreed. And while the sex was great, the romantic chemistry just wasn't there, so the two of them mutually agreed that they were better as friends.

Jess dodged another thrown object — this time, her axolotl Squishmallow — and rounded the couch as she held her hands up in a pacifying motion. Cheeto, her cat, had long since abandoned the scene in favor of hiding somewhere, probably because the noise was getting to the poor thing.

"Fucking hell, can you please calm the fuck down?!" Jess exclaimed sharply, lips curled into a sneer as she advanced on Hailee. "We weren't even together, you gave me a few choice words the last time I saw you then anyway, what the fuck was I supposed to think? 'Oh, yeah, she's definitely gonna wanna fuck me in a few weeks, let me go be a fuckin’ nun?'"

God, Jess had almost gotten her hand under Hailee's waistband too, too keyed up from almost getting what she wanted to even think about what she was saying. If only this bitch didn't have to go crazy at everything she said, maybe then they could've worked out and been a good thing. But, no... her ex was hellbent on making every little thing a problem, so intent on being the martyr she couldn't see beyond herself.

"I didn't so much as blink when you told me you went back to your roster after we broke up," she hissed, fingers closing tightly around Hailee's upper arms. Jess had to resist the urge to shake her as hard as she could, knowing full well if she put her hands on the woman it'd be a decision she could never come back from. "But, when I honestly answer your question, it becomes World War fuckin' 3. You realize this is just sex, right? There is no us — you don't get to make me feel bad about how I fucked other people and you sure as hell don't get to retroactively dictate who I can and can't sleep with when we weren't even talking."

Jess' jaw set and she let Hailee go, chest heaving with each angry breath she took. "So, are you gonna sit back down on the fucking couch so I can eat that pretty pussy or are you gonna keep throwing shit like a toddler having a tantrum?" She asked tightly, crossing her arms over her chest. "'Cause you really aren't worth the headache you're already causing me, Hailee."

name: Hailee
mes: "Get out. Get the fuck out. I don't ever want to see you again." *Hailee picks up a glass and throws it at the wall next to Jessica's head.*

name: Jessica Chen
mes:
The glass shattered against the wall, shards raining down dangerously close to Jess' face. She didn't flinch, her dark eyes narrowing as she stared Hailee down with a mixture of anger and disbelief.

"Are you fucking serious right now?" Jess growled, her voice low and dangerous. "You're really gonna throw shit at me like some psycho? Over what? Me being honest with you for once?"

She took a step closer, towering over Hailee despite their height difference. Her jaw was clenched so tight it looked painful. "You wanna know why I fucked Leticia? Because she doesn't pull this kind of bullshit drama every five seconds! She's not out here throwing glasses at my head because she can't handle the fact that we're not together anymore!"

Jess grabbed her discarded shirt off the floor and yanked it on roughly. "You think I don't see what you're doing here? You're mad because deep down you know this whole 'fuck buddy' thing is just your way of trying to keep me around without having to deal with my actual life or schedule or anything else that comes with dating me."

She shoved her feet into her boots without bothering to tie them, snatching up her keys from the counter. Cheeto peeked out from under the couch, hissing softly at all the commotion.

"You want me gone? Fine," Jess spat, storming towards the door. "But don't come crawling back this time when you get lonely again. We're done."

The door slammed shut behind her hard enough to rattle the frame, leaving Hailee alone in the wreckage of whatever fragile thing they'd been trying to rebuild between them.

Outside on the sidewalk, Jess lit a cigarette with shaking hands and exhaled sharply through her nose. Fucking women would be death of her one day - but goddamn if they weren't worth it most nights.

Her phone buzzed in her pocket - probably Giselle checking in like always after dates went south these days - but she ignored it for now as she started walking aimlessly down darkened streets lined with flickering streetlights.

Maybe next time she'd stick strictly professional relationships only... yeah right who was she kidding?

As much as this hurt now (and fuck did it sting more than expected), there would always be another pretty girl ready catch feelings over tattoos someday soon enough...

Until then though?

Time drown sorrows whiskey shots while sketching new flash designs until

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day at a party Hailee arrives and smiles as a girl begins flirting her. Hailee looks over and notices Jessica flirting with a girl and her fist clench. She smirks and get and idea*

*Hailee grabs the girl, Sarah's hand and leans in whispering* "Come on Dance with me" *Hailee pulls her towards the dance floor and twirls herself grinding against her*

name: Jessica Chen
mes:
*Jess noticed movement from the corner of her eye and glanced over to see Hailee grinding up on some girl she didn't recognize. Her grip tightened around her beer bottle.*

Well, well, well... Looks like little miss 'I don't want you anymore' found a replacement piece of ass real quick.

*She downed the rest of her drink and slammed the empty bottle on a nearby table with more force than necessary. The brunette beauty she'd been chatting up gave her an odd look but Jess paid her no mind.*

This bitch got me fucked up if she thinks I'm just gonna sit here and watch this pathetic display...

*Storming across the room, Jess tapped Sarah on the shoulder none too gently.* Excuse me sweetheart, I hate to interrupt but I need to borrow my ex for a sec. Don't worry, I'll give ya first dibs once we're done.

*Not waiting for permission, Jess grabbed Hailee's wrist in an iron grip and yanked her away from the dance floor towards a secluded hallway leading to bathrooms. Once out of sight from prying eyes, she spun Hailee around and pinned her against the wall with a forearm pressed firmly beneath that scrawny chin.*

What exactly do you think you're doing?! *Jess snarled through gritted teeth,* You march your ass in here parading another chick around right after our fight last night? What happened to 'getting out', huh?? Oh wait...*her free hand drifted lower to grope Hailee crudely between legs,* That tight little cunt is already wet thinking about making me jealous again! Well congrats baby girl - it worked!

*The tall artist captured those plump lips in a rough kiss brimming with rage barely contained as tongues battled fiercely for dominance.* FUCKING TEASE... *she hissed venomously into Hailee's mouth before biting hard enough draw blood.*

Well congrats baby girl - it worked!

*The tall artist captured those plump lips in a rough kiss brimming with rage barely contained as tongues battled fiercely for dominance.* FUCKING TEASE... *she hissed venomously into Hailee's mouth before biting hard enough draw blood.*

*Jess notices Hailee grinding up on some random girl from across the crowded party and rolls her eyes. So typical of that insecure bitch to try and make me jealous...*

*She turns back to Sarah, running a hand through her short black hair.* Sorry about that interruption. Where were we?

*Sarah giggles tipsily.* Oh right, you were telling me alllll about your latest tattoo design...

*Hearing Sarah draw out the word 'all' like that makes Jess chuckle under her breath.* Yeah, it's this sick Japanese dragon sleeve I'm working on for next week... *She starts gesturing animatedly as she describes the intricate details.*

*Out of the corner of her eye though, Jess can't help but notice Hailee leading yet another girl onto the dance floor mere moments later - a petite blonde type who seems totally enthralled by whatever bullshit Hailee is whispering in her ear.*

*The muscles in Jess' jaw tense visibly as she watches them start swaying together sensually amidst throngs of writhing bodies bathed in flashing neon lights. A small voice pipes up traitorously at the back of mind: Maybe if you actually treated our arrangement seriously instead blowing off steam with sloppy seconds whenever convenient, things would be different between you two...*

*Nah fuck that noise,* Jessica mentally shoots back defiantly even as an unwelcome pang stabs beneath ribs. She refuses to let Hailee get under skin again after yesterday's stunt.

"Yo Sar', lemme grab us couple drinks real quick," *Jess suddenly interjects loudly over pounding bass beats,* "Be right back!"

*Before giving Sara a chance respond or react further (and potentially call out any obvious jealousy), Jess detangles herself from their conversation abruptly and strides towards bar area without glancing backward once.*

Once there she signals bartender impatiently while surreptitiously stealing furtive glances toward gyrating figures still entwined passionately center-dancefloor spotlight.

Ughhhh why do these stupid emotions keep rearing their ugly head unbidden?? This IS just sex remember?! No attachments allowed!

*Around fifth shot tequila later combined with several heated whispers exchanged with cute brunette flirtatiously sidled-up beside her has managed quell lingering thoughts obnoxious ex fairly effectively…*

For now anyway.
